content.description:
One of the gems in the canyon. Beautiful blue ice.  
 Pitch 1 - A steep start but eases off after 15 meters. Find a suitable place to build a screw anchor before the next steep section and belay. 
 Pitch 2/3 - Can be combined as the climbing is not terribly difficult. Ascend a series of steep walls to the trees. Several options for topping out. Easier to finish left.

Directly below the Eye of The Needle. Left of Giza's Way Out.
A dozen screws would be nice if you want to do it in two pitches.

Begin by dry tooling to get above a small overhang and then onto a verglassed slab (in late season ice is thicker as evident in the photo). Trend slightly right to better ice and then straight up into the trees. Sustained, difficult climbing for the first 2/3 of the route.

This is the first route on the north side of the Eye of the Needle that has been climbed. The easiest way to access is to follow the brook down past the Sea Monster area until you can see The Eye of the Needle. El Grotto is the second line encountered as you approach the eye.
A rack of screws and extra balls as this is very run out near the bottom.

A very pretty line that meanders up a large gully. Fun climbing on all three pitches. Beautiful blue ice on the final pitch.

Found 15 meters left of Tequila Sunrise.
A rack of screws. Tree and or screw belays, tree anchor on top.

Climb 60 meters of easy ice and steep snow up a wandering gully to reach a bench below a nice steep wall of ice. Ascend the broad curtain to the trees.

Located about 35 meters downstream from the Blue Wall on the same side of Walton Glen Brook (south bank). Find a narrow band of ice leading up and right into a hidden gully.
A rack of screws. Tree anchor.

Note: This route is not a first ascent as it was likely climbed during the early forays into this area, however, it should be recorded as a climb and reference for The Blue Wall because it makes for an excellent entry and exit point.

Found just right of the Blue Wall is a large low angle waterfall with two distinct lines. Climb the left line leading straight up into the drainage.
A few screws. Tree anchor.

Climb a short pillar of ice until you can move right to a vertical curtain of ice. Ascend the curtain and continue up through a series of pillars to the trees.

Located 20 meters right of Fireball Alley or 40 meters left of Gin and Tonic.
Rack of screws. Tree anchor.

Awesome line up a hidden gulley. An easy 50 degree snow ramp leads to a cleft of rock. A few moves on rock will lead to a narrow ribbon of ice. The crux is usually WI4+ in early season. Later in the season ice should build over a log near the top forming a roof. The roof was there on the first ascent making for a very exciting finish.


This route is found downstream of The Eye of The Needle. Best accessed by crossing the brook across from The Blue Wall. Walk downstream for about 50 meters then look up and left for a snowfield. Follow the snowfield to the gully. You can safely rapell the route with a 70 meter rope or double ropes. Some down climbing will be required if you have a single 60.
A rack of screws. Tree anchor.

A fun and very aesthetic piece of ice in a great setting high on the wall overlooking the canyon.

Located just around the corner to the left of Narwhal. Only about 150 feet from the top of the snowfield. Rap the route.
A rack of screws. Tree anchor.

A narrow band of ice in a 2 meter wide gully.

Located 50 meters below Fireball Alley or 100 meters upstream from the confluence.
A rack of screws.

Pleasant climbing up a long gully. Note: This route is not a first ascent as it was likely climbed during the early forays into this area, however, it should be recorded as a climb and reference for The Blue Wall because it makes for an excellent entry and exit point.

Just right of the Blue Wall is a large low angle waterfall with two distinct lines. Climb the right most line exiting in the trees right of the drainage.
A rack of screws. Tree anchor.

Climb a 5 meter wide curtain of ice to a steep snow ramp leading up and right. Pitch 2 ascends an easier slab of ice to the trees.

Located 15 meters to the right of Fireball Alley.
A rack of screws. Tree anchors.

The Eye of the Needle is the section of the canyon where the walls suddenly come very close together (about 10 feet at the narrowest point). This area includes all the climbs from this point up to the Sea Monster Wall.
